TpMKvGWRKuOzWMiK4.name: 2 - Choose 25 points in Advantages from the following:

features.situation: to skill rolls any time you take an unnecessary risk (in the GM’s opinion)

tG1_o6-1hZrNyQibg.name: Fit
tG1_o6-1hZrNyQibg.notes: Recover FP at twice the normal rate (but not FP spent for spells or psi powers)

features.situation: to all HT rolls to stay conscious, avoid death, resist disease, or resist poison

mLHwO5y_Nvlq9_kdw.name: Easy to Hit
mLHwO5y_Nvlq9_kdw.notes: Others can target your eyes at only -6 to hit

features.situation: to rolls for any lengthy mental task you concentrate on to the exclusion of other activities, if the GM feels such focus would be beneficial
to all rolls to notice interruptions while obsessed with a task

tVXEvrHubotDIJGQc.name: Unfazeable
tVXEvrHubotDIJGQc.notes: Exempt from fright checks. Reaction modifiers do not affect you.

TiP_oP6vlkm0mdU__.name: 3 - Choose one of the following Powers:

mHlALl_v_ZsFRojSM.name: Usually On
mHlALl_v_ZsFRojSM.notes: Turning visible costs 1 FP per second

mSCx9jT78d5pijwrF.name: Partial Change
mSCx9jT78d5pijwrF.notes: Can turn an item you are carrying substantial without dropping it

thk5u14FFP1i4miFb.name: Silence
thk5u14FFP1i4miFb.notes: Bonuses help only when hearing is the only sense that can be used to detect you.

features.situation: to Stealth when you are perfectly motionless
to Stealth if moving (even in armor, etc.)

m7qkbFwybEw5IfZei.name: Super
m7qkbFwybEw5IfZei.notes: Opposed by Anti-powers and weird science gadgets

mayQILIuPJ1mg-qdo.name: Nuisance Effect
mayQILIuPJ1mg-qdo.notes: Obvious popping noise at departure point

Ti1UxFo8fWdii4qDL.name: 4 - Choose -15 points from the following Disadvantages:

TbKC1i1auWt7r6dwh.name: One of the following Code of Honor Disadvantages, or

tuM9RvoKZwsb4y7jM.name: Code of Honor (Gentleman's)
tuM9RvoKZwsb4y7jM.notes: Never break your word. Never ignore an insult to yourself, a lady, or your flag; insults may only be wiped out by an apology or a duel (not necessarily to the death!). Never take advantage of an opponent in any way; weapons and circumstances must be equal (except in open war). This only applies between gentlemen.

tw9mzTZC5C8E9U7Ea.name: Code of Honor (Professional)
tw9mzTZC5C8E9U7Ea.notes: Adhere to the ethics of your profession; always do your job to the best of your ability; support your guild, union, or professional association.

TP2qdB9Sl9kX-flqy.name: One of the following Pacifism Disadvantages, or

tfVUHSov4krrXHE8W.name: Pacifism: Cannot Kill
tfVUHSov4krrXHE8W.notes: You may fight – you may even start fights – but you may never do anything that seems likely to kill another. This includes abandoning a wounded foe to die “on his own”! You must do your best to keep your companions from killing, too. If you do kill someone (or feel responsible for a death), you immediately suffer a nervous breakdown. Roll 3d and be totally morose and useless for that many days. During this time, you must make a Will roll to offer any sort of violence toward anyone, for any reason.

tx3A3fwbgqAMJtaRZ.name: Pacifism: Reluctant Killer
tx3A3fwbgqAMJtaRZ.notes: You are psychologically unprepared to kill people. Whenever you make a deadly attack (e.g., with a knife or a gun) against an obvious person whose face is visible to you, you are at -4 to hit and may not Aim. If you cannot see the foe’s face (due to a mask, darkness, or distance, or because you attacked from behind), the penalty is only -2, save in close combat. You have no penalty to attack a vehicle (even an occupied one), an opponent you do not believe is a person (including things with Horrific or Monstrous appearance), or a target you can’t actually see (e.g., a set of map coordinates or a blip on a radar screen). If you kill a recognizable person, the effect on you is the same as for Pacifism: Cannot Kill. You have no problem with your allies killing; you may even supply ammo, loaded weapons, and encouragement! You just can’t do the killing yourself.

tXIIcVDETu49Iu3-B.name: Pacifism: Self-Defense Only
tXIIcVDETu49Iu3-B.notes: You only fight to defend yourself or those in your care, using only as much force as necessary (no pre-emptive strikes allowed!). You must do your best to discourage others from starting fights.

tWZmM6wNkslbBDbwf.name: Pacifism: Total Nonviolence
tWZmM6wNkslbBDbwf.notes: You will not lift a hand against another intelligent creature, for any reason. You must do your nonviolent best to discourage violent behavior in others, too. You are free to defend yourself against attacks by animals, mosquitoes, etc.

TpSM2QTwbp-D6_bnc.name: One of the following Secret Disadvantages, or

tyy1qa2TfBMJ_ZgLZ.name: Combat Paralysis
tyy1qa2TfBMJ_ZgLZ.notes: In any situation in which personal harm seems imminent, make a HT roll. Do not roll until the instant you need to fight, run, pull the trigger, or whatever. Any roll over 13 is a failure, even if you have HT 14+. On a success, you can act normally. On a failure, you are mentally stunned.

tATUlJhvPeCAxjxqk.name: Overconfidence
tATUlJhvPeCAxjxqk.notes: You must make a self-control roll any time the GM feels you show an unreasonable degree of caution. If you fail, you must go ahead as though you were able to handle the situation!

features.situation: from young or naive individuals who believe you are as good as you say you are

tXV8At4pvLJExRivv.name: Post-Combat Shakes
tXV8At4pvLJExRivv.notes: Make a self-control roll at the end of any battle. If you fail, roll 3d, add the amount by which you failed your self-control roll, and look up the result on the Fright Check Table.

TBoExCJVycQr_8B6J.name: 5 - Choose one of the following Quirks

sb7CAiXPLKnsx-bom.name: Thief!
sb7CAiXPLKnsx-bom.notes: Skills: Climbing, Electronics Operation (Security), Escape, Filch, Forced Entry, Merchant, Pickpocket, and Stealth. Make an IQ-based roll for Lockpicking, Shadowing, Streetwise, or Traps.

srVS5ph8sux5oui6J.name: Move!
srVS5ph8sux5oui6J.notes: Skills: Acrobatics, Aerobatics, Aquabatics, Body Sense, Climbing, Free Fall, Jumping, and Stealth. Works as Escape to move through narrow openings – and, at the GM’s discretion, as some forms of Dancing and Erotic Art. Make a HTbased roll for Flight, Hiking, Jumping, Running, Skating, Skiing, or Swimming. Any such HT-based roll results in +20% to the day’s travel in whatever mode of movement it covers. Move! can also take the place of any unarmed combat skill if performing some sort of fancy movement while attacking; Move! at DX+2 or better grants +1 per die to damage with such attacks.

SQIFmXMU21yj5vPil.name: 8 - Choose one of the following Additional Skills

slX0ijCrpAqfvIRtG.name: Judo
slX0ijCrpAqfvIRtG.notes: Allows parrying two different attacks per turn, one with each hand.

nj6ed4Hn4nw-2rYOi.text: 250 points - You specialize in infiltration: going where you’re not supposed to be, without being noticed. Your powers are subtle and don’t have direct combat effects, though they can help you surprise a foe or avoid his attacks.
